intro: Enkylia digyna, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lily, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to rock gardens and alpine landscapes. Enkylia digyna is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
